result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Manuel Silva Pozos

records.addlTxt: CONDITIONS MODIFIED ON 10/18

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant to have no violent contact with victim A or her children/witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to discuss this case with the victim, her children or any third parties, except his attorney.

8:48 AM Defendant Manuel Silva Pozos in court.  Attorney John Paul Marchan in court for Manuel Silva Pozos.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim A appearing in person.  Patrick Ryan appeared in person as interpreter and previously sworn. 
Atty. Marchan moves to modify bond.  State objects to the motion.  Court grants motion.  Date remains as previously set.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on October 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on September 26th, 2022.
Motion and Order to Seal Request to be Heard, Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on September 23rd, 2022.
Motion and Order to Seal Victim's Request To Be Heard, filed by the State.

Victim A's Request to be Heard, filed by the State.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 9/27/2022 - Due to Branch 2's calendar during the upcoming month, this request will be heard during a bail/bond hearing in front of a court commissioner.**

9:01 AM Defendant Manuel Silva Pozos in court.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Dawn Maldonado appeared and was sworn in as interpreter.
Court conducts colloquy with defendant regarding the Petition for Appointment of Attorney that was filed. Defendant sworn. 
Court grants request, repayment plan to be addressed at the next hearing. 
Defendant to call clerk's office by the end of the week to find out who the Attorney is as he does not have a mailing address at this time.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on November 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Notarized and filed by defendant.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Hearing on September 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 08/30/2022.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant to have no contact with victim A or her children/witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.

2:03 PM Defendant Manuel Silva Pozos in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder.  Dawn Maldonado appearing as interpreter for the defendant.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
